data.title: std::shared_ptr<bool> -> std::shared_ptr<std::atomic<bool>>
data.body:
The reference count field in shared_ptr is thread safe but the value field is not. So we need to wrap a std::atomic for preventing potential thread racing.

Refer to http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/shared_ptr/atomic

If multiple threads of execution access the same std::shared_ptr object without synchronization and any of those accesses uses a non-const member function of shared_ptr then a data race will occur unless all such access is performed through these functions, which are overloads of the corresponding atomic access functions (std::atomic_load, std::atomic_store, etc.)
Note that the control block of a shared_ptr is thread-safe: different std::shared_ptr objects can be accessed using mutable operations, such as operator= or reset, simultaneously by multiple threads, even when these instances are copies, and share the same control block internally.

data.title: extend the RichText
data.body:
This is a PR to extend the RichText.
- Set of default values.
- Append to ability to extend the tags.
- Add the effect of outline, shadow and glow.
- Catch a event of open url.
- Anchor of the image tag.

I have consulted the arguments for the initialization function of RichElementText.
By this time of expansion, the number of arguments of the init() and create() has increased (8 -> 11). The increase was the argument made to have a default value, you have to maintain compatibility, but you will not be able to be only part of the growing argument.
For example, I think that the argument is ValueMap or the structure, but when it will change, it will affect compatibility.
If there is good correspondence way, will not you tell me?

data.title: Older Coco Studio binaries are crashing in v3.10
data.body:
v3.10. Tried using source and also creating a new project using Cocos Launcher.

This repo: https://github.com/chukong/CocosStudioSamples

clone it and try and build the iOS project. It will run and you will crash at the first `.csb` it tries to load.

Users are complaining about this and also starting to experience this in their own projects. Older Cocos Studio files are not working in newer Cocos2d-x projects. 

Some users are reporting this starts in v3.4 and some users are reporting going back to v3.7 and things work as expected again.

@pandamicro @linshun

data.title: Removed unnecessary search paths.
data.body:
Since we now have (almost) single search path.
The search path for editor-support is kept as spine requires it and it uses `#include <....>`.

I also refactored the cmake script for link spidermonkey library:
1. moved `code into cocos/scripting/js-bindings/CMakeLists.txt` and
2. use `find_library` instead of `link_directories`.

data.title: Bugging when use setPhysicsBody and runAction(Animate*) at the same time
Clear FontAtlasCache on change content scale factor
data.body:
Hi.
I'v found a bug that LabelBMFont are broken if changed content scale factor.
It becomes FontAtlasCache.
It works fine if I cleared the caches.
Thanks.

data.title: Single include search path
data.body:
This PR makes all sources (c, cpp, h, hpp, inl) in cocos directory include cocos2d-x headers in with path relative to cocos directory (As discussed in #15250 the No. 1 issue)
1. Add a include linter script in `tools/coding-style/include-linter.py`
2. Fixes 1605 include path in 541 files using above script.

~~TODO: May cocos2d-x team add `tools/coding-style/include-linter.py` in CI script.~~

data.title: How to clear or delete UserDefault
data.body:
I simulate my app in both IOS and MAC. I can easily delete saved UserDefault data on IOS but i dont know how to do it in MAC simulator. I can't also find the UserDefault.xml in /Library/Caches or in /Documents..

I also tried clean then building the app but no avail.. Pls help

Ticket id: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/15275

Add `getString` to MenuItemLabel class.

data.title: fix: use correct call to get the B constraint in physics
[cocos2d-x-js][3.10] mismatch between JS and bindings
data.body:
At http://cocos2d-x.org/docs/api-ref/js/v3x/symbols/cc.MenuItemLabel.html, it show that class has getString() method to return the string of cc.MenuItemLabel If you look at http://www.cocos2d-x.org/docs/api-ref/cplusplus/v3x/d5/dc4/classcocos2d_1_1_menu_item_label.html, this method doesn't exist. When using JS bindings, application will crash due to missing getString binding: 
        onEnter: function() {
            item = new cc.MenuItemToggle(                               
                new cc.MenuItemFont(getTranslation("ENGLISH")),         
                new cc.MenuItemFont(getTranslation("FRENCH")),          
                this.switchLanguage,                                    
                this                                                    
            );                                                          
        },
        switchLanguage: function (evt) {                                  
            try {                                                         
                var cur = evt.getSelectedItem();                          
                cc.log("cur : " + cur);                                   
                cc.log("string: " + cur.getString());                       
            } catch (ex) {
                cc.log("=> " + ex.message);
            }
will output 
E/Cocos2DX(14417): cur : [object MenuItemFont]
E/Cocos2DX(14417): => cur.getString is not a function
Please remove getString from cocos2d-x-js or implementit on cocos2d-x :) Regards, Michael
